{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks for sequelae of fetal alcohol syndrome. According to the documents, characteristic features of fetal alcohol syndrome include microcephalus, prenatal and postnatal growth retardation, small palpebral fissures and mental deficiency. Additionally, congenital cardiac defects, anomalies of the genitalia and other malformations are frequently found. Based on this information, we can rule out macrocephaly as it is not mentioned in any of the documents. Holoprosencephaly is also not mentioned. Thinning of corpus callosum is a potential feature but it is not explicitly stated as a sequelae of fetal alcohol syndrome. Therefore, microcephaly is the most likely answer.", "answer_choice": C}
